wikipedia_page.main: Godfrey Martin Huggins, 1st Viscount Malvern  (6 July 1883 – 8 May 1971), was a Rhodesian politician and physician. He served as the fourth Prime Minister of Southern Rhodesia from 1933 to 1953 and remained in office as the first Prime Minister of the Federation of Rhodesia and Nyasaland until October 1956, becoming the longest serving prime minister in British Commonwealth history.

link_mentions.page: List of places named after people
response: * Malvernia was the name of Chicualacuala (Vila Eduardo Mondlane) - Godfrey Huggins, 1st Viscount Malvern
